contentrichtext.text: {{Refimprove|date=December 2009}} {|{{Infobox ship begin}} {{Infobox ship image |Ship image= |Ship caption= }} {{Infobox ship career |Ship country={{Nowrap|United Kingdom}} |Ship flag={{Shipboxflag|United Kingdom|naval}} |Ship name=HMS ''Singleton'' |Ship builder=[[Montrose Shipyard]] |Ship laid down= |Ship launched= 18 November 1955 |Ship commissioned= |Ship recommissioned= |Ship decommissioned= |Ship motto= |Ship nickname= |Ship honours= |Ship fate=Sold to Australia |Ship notes= |Ship badge= }} {{Infobox ship career |Ship country=Australia |Ship flag={{Shipboxflag|Australia|naval}} |Ship name=HMAS ''Ibis'' |Ship acquired=1961 |Ship commissioned=7 September 1962 |Ship decommissioned=4 May 1984 |Ship motto="Safe Waters" |Ship nickname= |Ship honours='''Battle honours:'''<br />[[Indonesia–Malaysia confrontation|Malaysia]] 1964-66<br />Plus one [[HMAS Ibis#Battle honours|inherited battle honour]] |Ship fate=Decommissioned |Ship notes= |Ship badge= }} {{Infobox ship characteristics |Ship class=[[Ton class minesweeper]] |Ship displacement=440 tons |Ship length={{Convert|152|ft|m|abbr=on}} |Ship beam={{Convert|28|ft|m|abbr=on}} |Ship draught={{Convert|8|ft|m|abbr=on}} |Ship propulsion=Originally [[MAN B&W Diesel|Mirrlees diesel]], later [[Napier Deltic]], producing {{Convert|3000|shp|kW|abbr=on}} on each of two shafts |Ship speed={{Convert|15|kn}} |Ship complement=33 |Ship sensors= |Ship EW= |Ship armament=2 x [[Bofors 40 mm gun]]<br>1 x [[M2 Browning machine gun]] |Ship notes= }} |} '''HMAS ''Ibis'' (M 1183)''' was a [[Ton class minesweeper]] built by the Montrose Shipyard, launched on 18 November 1955, and commissioned into the [[Royal Navy]] as '''HMS ''Singleton''. The ship was purchased by Australia in 1961, and commissioned into the [[Royal Australian Navy]] as HMAS ''Ibis'' on 7 September 1962. During the mid-1960s, ''Ibis'' was one of several ships operating in support of the Malaysian government during the [[Indonesia-Malaysia Confrontation]]. This service was later recognised with the [[battle honour]] "Malaysia 1964-66".<ref name=newhonours>{{cite news |url=http://www.navy.gov.au/Navy_Marks_109th_Birthday_With_Historic_Changes_To_Battle_Honours |title=Navy Marks 109th Birthday With Historic Changes To Battle Honours |date=1 March 2010 |archiveurl=http://web.archive.org/web/20110613184920/http://www.navy.gov.au/Navy_Marks_109th_Birthday_With_Historic_Changes_To_Battle_Honours |archivedate=13 June 2011 |publisher=Royal Australian Navy |accessdate=23 December 2012}}</ref><ref name=honourslist>{{cite web |url=http://www.navy.gov.au/w/images/Units_entitlement_list.pdf |title=Royal Australian Navy Ship/Unit Battle Honours |date=1 March 2010 |publisher=Royal Australian Navy |archiveurl=http://web.archive.org/web/20110614064156/http://www.navy.gov.au/w/images/Units_entitlement_list.pdf |archivedate=14 June 2011 |accessdate=23 December 2012}}</ref> ''Ibis'' was decommissioned on 4 May 1984. <!-- non-breaking space to keep AWB drones from altering the space before the navbox--> ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Ton class minesweeper}} {{Use dmy dates|date=February 2011}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Ibis}} [[Category:Ton-class minesweepers of the Royal Navy]] [[Category:Ships built in the United Kingdom]] [[Category:1955 ships]] [[Category:Cold War minesweepers of the United Kingdom]] [[Category:Ton-class minesweepers of the Royal Australian Navy]] [[Category:Cold War minesweepers of Australia]] {{Australia-mil-ship-stub}}
